info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 25 at 2:26AM CDT until October 25 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR WEBSTER...SOUTHEASTERN DE SOTO...RED RIVER...WESTERN CLAIBORNE... WESTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER PARISHES... At 226 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shongaloo to 6 miles east of Minden to near Ringgold to 10 miles east of Mansfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Minden, Mansfield, Homer, Haughton, Haynesville, Coushatta, Ringgold, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Gibsland, Doyline, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Heflin, Shongaloo, Evergreen, Hall Summit, Castor, Athens and Edgefield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
